title: add google() repo
body:
This is required to be able to compile the project outside of Android Studio,
i.e. for F-Droid.

Fixes:
> Could not find com.android.tools.build:gradle:3.0.1.

title: Make clean code & Ignore lint error
Some improvements of rootless-Logcat
body:
Hi, please review below improvements.

* Add row background (white, and grey background)
* Rename Search option  to Filter option 
  - Filter by tag (case insensitive)
  - Filter by keyword (case insensitive, and RED background on keyword)
  - tag and keyword has history list. 
  - Show auto complete from history 
* Add new Search option
  - Just highlight search word, not filter (case insensitive)
  - YELLOW background on search word
  - auto completion form history
* Add "Delete all" button
* Add row long click menu 
  - Copy text
  - Show pretty JSON (and copy button)

Next time I want to implement Overlay log view.
Thank you.

title: Add filter options
body: Grep like, include this, exclude that.

title: Option to change address and port
Option for logging with root access
body: Is there any chance you could add the option to use root access instead of enabling remote debugging for logging?

title: Publishing on F-Droid?
body: I'd love to see your app on [F-Droid](https://f-droid.org). If you are OK with this, I'll add it.

title: Publish APK at Github?
body: Would you consider publishing the `.apk` here at Github, for folks without Playstore? Preferably in the `releases/` section (see: [Creating Releases](https://help.github.com/articles/creating-releases/) in the GitHub Help), which is really easy. If you'd do so, I could automatically pick it up (within 24h or your attaching it there) and offer it via [my F-Droid compatible repo](https://android.izzysoft.de/repo), and those folks would get automated updates even.

title: If there anyway to skip the step that typing “adb tcpip 5555” in computer ?
re: playstore comments
body:
To expand on the play store comments:
- the way I use this is to look at logs where it's not easy to attach a proper logcat viewer. For example something gps-related, or wifi/cell network crossing. It is much easier to match what happens in the physical world (e.g. I've stepped outside the wifi range) with what happens in the app if I could look at the logs for the app right when I'm moving around. Certainly I can copy the log and email it to myself, but then I'd have to remember the exact time when something happened to match it with the log later. So filtering by bundle id would be immensely helpful.
- timestamps aren't even shown on the play store screenshots, so I'm sure it's easy to reproduce ;)
